name: Cave Keese*3, Bonestalker z*2, Cave Ritz

parameters: 'Skills'
\talk\c1Skills\c are physical attacks that cost PP to use.
\talkPP is gained by \c1dealing or receiving damage\c.
\talkBuild up PP by attacking then unleash your powerful \c1Skills.\c
'Spells'
\talk\c1Spells\c are magical attacks that cost MP to use.
\talkMP is gained by \c1guarding or using items\c.
\talkEach character has an affinity for a specific \c1element\c. Janelle for example
has the \c1Thunder affinity\c making her \c1Thunder\c spells more powerful.
\talkYou may view each character's affinity from the menu.
\talk\c1Spells\c also build up PP so that you may use \c1Skills.\c
\talkProper balance between using \c1Attack, Skills and Spells\c is key to
effective combat.
'Blue haired Girl'
edsel
\talk What is that one doing?
'Janelle'
doria morer
\talk It's charging up a big attack.\. We need to
hit \c1him with any skill or status ailment to stop him.\c
Enemies will \c1charge their strong skills or spells for 1 turn and then use it on
the next turn\c.
You can prevent them from using their big attack by hitting them with
\c1Physical Skills or inflicting any status ailment\c while they're charging.
Enemies are also more vulnerable to status ailments while charging.

name: Filler Spell, Filler Skill, Attacker Skill
Filler Spell, Filler Skill, Attacker Spell
Filler Skill, Filler Spell, Attacker Skill*2
Filler Spell, Attacker Skill, Attacker Spell

parameters: 'Eris'
eris
\talkH-Hey, don't forget, we're still back here.
'Ceres'
Ceres more
\talkAnd we can still use \c1Support Spells\c and Items even if
we can't fight.
The two Item Shopkeepers, Ceres and Eris, are present in this fight.\. The two of
them are non-combatants.\. Enemies cannot attack non-combatants
so long as at least one combatant is alive.
Do not forget that \c1Inflicting Status Ailments\c also prevents enemies from
charging attacks.
'Skills'
\talk\c1Skills\c are physical attacks that cost SP to use.
\talkSP is gained by \c1dealing or receiving damage\c.
\talkBuild up SP by attacking then unleash your powerful \c1Skills.\c
'Spells'
\talk\c1Spells\c are magical attacks that cost MP to use.
\talkMP is gained by \c1Shielding\c or using \c1Supplies\c.
\talkEach character has an affinity for a specific \c1element\c. Hannah for example
has the \c1Wind affinity\c making her \c1Wind\c spells more powerful.
\talkYou may view each character's affinity from the menu.
\talk\c1Spells\c also build up SP so that you may use \c1Skills.\c
\talkProper balance between using \c1Attack, Skills and Spells\c is key to
effective combat.
'Ceres'
Ceres more - Copy
\talkI might not be able to fight but I can still help.
'Support'
\talk\c1Non-Combatants\c can use \c1Supplies\c and \c1Support Spells\c to inflict buffs,
debuffs and other supportive effects.
\talk\c1Support Spells\c are performed immediately without consuming a
combatant's turn. However \c1a cooldown of 3 turns must pass\c before
another \c1Support Spell\c is performed.
\talkTry using \i[387]\c1Ceres' Support Spell Analyze\c in order to
reveal an enemy's health bar.
'Hannah'
mirch
\talk What is that one doing?
'Mirch'
mirch
\talk It's charging up a big attack.\. We need to
hit 1him with any \c1Single Target Skill\c or \c1Status Ailment\c to stop him.
Enemies will \c1charge their strong Skills or Spells for 1 turn before
unleashing it the next turn\c.
You can prevent them from using their big attack by hitting them with
\c1Single Target Skills or inflicting any Status Ailment\c while
they're charging.
Enemies are also \c1more vulnerable to Status Ailments while charging\c.
'Eris'
boke
\talkI might not be able to fight but I can still help.
'Support'
\talk\c1Non-Combatants\c such as Ceres and Eris can use \c1Support Spells\c to inflict buffs,
debuffs and other supportive effects
\talkSelect \c1Support\c from the \c1Battle Menu\c below \c1Spells\c in order to
use \c1Support\c. \c1Support\c has a cooldown of three turns.
'Mirch'
mirch
\talkWe'll have to put this one down quickly. It's just going to
summon more of its kin if we take too long.
'Hannah'
mirch
\talkThis thing's way too bulky. How are we supposed to do that?
'Ceres'
Ceres more
\talkI have something that might help.\. this \c1\ii[8]\c
should strengthen Edsel's spells enough to take that
thing down.
'Edsel'
mirch emotions
\talkHold on, why's it gotta be me? Don't you have a \c1\ii[13]\c
for Hannah? Or a \c1\ii[9]\c for Norton instead?
mirch emotions
\talkThey have much more experience than I do.
'Eris'
boke
\talkToday's a Saintday so only \c1\ii[8]\c would work. And
you're the only one with \c1Holy Affinity\c here right now.
'Norton'
mirch
\talkYou're a better caster than you think, Edsel. Get ready
to blast this thing with your \c1spells\c after Ceres gives
you that \c1\ii[8]\c.
'Hannah'
mirch
\talkThere's too many of them. And they're all protecting the big
one. I can't target it.
'Hannah'
mirch
\talkWe'll have to take care of the smaller ones first then.
